snippet: A board voted to reduce the maximum size of new retail establishments to 4,000 square feet, effectively thwarting an effort by CVS to open a 6,928-square-foot store in the Westchester County hamlet.
abstract: Katonah, NY, small town in Westchester County, adopts zoning change limiting new retail stores to 4,000 square feet, effectively blocking plans by CVS Health to open larger outlet.
lead_paragraph: A board voted to reduce the maximum size of new retail establishments to 4,000 square feet, effectively thwarting an effort by CVS to open a 6,928-square-foot store in the Westchester County hamlet.

headline.main: Panel Blocks a Larger CVS Store in Katonah
headline.print_headline: Panel Blocks a Larger CVS Store in a Westchester Hamlet
